an4.107:4.1: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of mice.
an4.107:4.3: ~One makes a hole but doesn’t live in it, ~one lives in a hole but doesn’t make it, ~one neither makes a hole nor lives in it, and ~one both makes a hole and lives in it.
an4.107:4.4: These are the four kinds of mice.
an4.107:4.5: In the same way, these four people similar to mice are found in the world.
an4.107:4.7: ~One makes a hole but doesn’t live in it, ~one lives in a hole but doesn’t make it, ~one neither makes a hole nor lives in it, and ~one both makes a hole and lives in it.
an4.107:5.1: And how does a person make a hole but not live in it?
an4.107:5.2: It’s when a person memorizes the teaching—
an4.107:5.3: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired sayings, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and analyses.
an4.107:5.4: But they don’t really understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
an4.107:5.5: That’s how a person makes a hole but doesn’t live in it.
an4.107:5.6: That person is like a mouse that makes a hole but doesn’t live in it, I say.
an4.107:6.1: And how does a person live in a hole but not make it?
an4.107:6.2: It’s when a person doesn’t memorize the teaching …
an4.107:6.4: But they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …
an4.107:7.1: And how does a person neither make a hole nor live in it?
an4.107:7.2: It’s when a person doesn’t memorize the teaching …
an4.107:7.4: Nor do they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …
an4.107:8.1: And how does a person both make a hole and live in it?
an4.107:8.2: It’s when a person memorizes the teaching …
an4.107:8.4: And they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …
an4.107:8.8: These four people similar to mice are found in the world.”
